column4: Is there any way to use dapper to patch a program when installing ?
for example, i need to patch wine before installing it, do i have to manually install or is it possible to use dapper ?
apt-get build it from source
usually winehq has premade debs too of their latest
yea but i have to patch the source :p
latelst WoW is 1.12.x?
if so: http://appdb.winehq.org/appview.php?iVersionId=5606
omg lol
tell me, if i already built the source from scratch, and then use apt-get to install wine again, will it override my settings for me ?
no it won't
how can i remove my source installation ? .p
dpg -r? or what you mean? have you built a .edb or not? if there is no .deb, there is no good way to uninstall. and the config might be overwritten too
ONLY proper way to install is via .debs, selfmade debs or from a repository
how about .tar.gz
as I said: NO
i used apt-get source wine, and then installed it :P
lol too bad
then you installed a .deb via dpkg -i? that's fine. now dpkg can remove it too (or apt)
btw they are using alot older version of wine, is that alright ?
that's what I don't get. I'd say in newer versions of wine, those patches should be already in. have you tested them?
i only tested the latest wine using apt-get install
however wow crashed :(
i can see the intro! but when it comes to the login screen i crash
